title: What did China import from the silk road, historically? - Quora

response.answer_text: Though I cannot offer an expert, comprehensive answer, I can just mention: Rome shipped so much gold eastwards that it ruined the Empire’s finances.Silk was then restricted to the elite.Roman gold coins have been found across India: they were used to date archaeological sites.A merchants storeroom was found underground in Afghanistan; it contains some of my favourite glassware:Begram : The GlassEnamelled glass depicting a gladiator, found at Begram, Afghanistan, which was once part of the Greco-Bactrian Kingdom, but was ruled by the Kushan Empire during the contemporaneous Roman Principate period, to which the glass belongs, 52–125 AD (although there is some scholarly debate about the precise dating).[3] More:
